speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Kirby, we've got a few minutes before your mother gets here.  One last question: In our studies this week, what did we learn about William Henry Harrison?

speaker: Kirby
text: Well, I guess I would say that this week we learned that William Henry Harrison was... a great man... who was important ...because he was...

speaker: Frasier
text: President?

speaker: Kirby
text: No.  Yes!  Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good, good.  And which president was he?

speaker: Kirby
text: Of the United States.

speaker: Frasier
text: I mean which number?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, here's a hint: He was elected in eighteen-forty.

speaker: Kirby
text: Eighteen.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Kirby
text: Fortieth?

speaker: Frasier
text: Kirby!  Did you do any reading this week?

speaker: Kirby
text: Sort of.

speaker: Frasier
text: What does "sort of" mean?

speaker: Kirby
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Why not?

speaker: Kirby
text: 'Cause it's a bunch of junk I'm never gonna need to know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Kirby, this "junk", as you call it, may seem unimportant to you now, but knowing something about where we came from may help you to decide where you wish to go.  Now, let's start learning about history, lest you be condemned to repeat it. [_He pushes the text book over to Kirby._] Start reading.  Continue until your mother gets here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.  You know that guy, Roger, on fourteen, has that little Scottish Terrier?

speaker: Frasier
text: MacDuff?

speaker: Martin
text: Right.  Well, Roger's invited all these dogs from the park to a party, for MacDuff's birthday.  Except Eddie, thank God! Have you ever heard of anything more ridiculous?

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  And putting a hat on Eddie, for every major holiday, that's normal?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's not every holiday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, please!  He's got a Santa cap for Christmas, he's got a top hat for New Year's Eve, he's got a tam o'shanter for St. Patrick's day...

speaker: Martin
text: Well, they're just hats!  It's not a whole party.  I mean, a dog doesn't know it's his birthday any more than he knows it's Friday or Saturday or...

speaker: Frasier
text: Or Cinco de Mayo?

speaker: Martin
text: That sombrero was a gift!

speaker: Frasier
text: Keep reading!

speaker: Martin
text: It's nice you're helpin' the kid out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, well, truth be told, Dad, I'm actually... I've made a little agreement with Lana.  You see, if I help Kirby get a passing grade, Lana will set me up with one of her girlfriends, Claire.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  I remember when you used to tutor kids so they wouldn't beat you up.   So I guess this is progress, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: That'll be your mother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Lana.  Come on in.

speaker: Lana
text: Hi, Frasier.  You guys have a good study session today?

speaker: Kirby
text: Primo.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, we're making excellent progress.

speaker: Lana
text: Really?  So, what did you learn today?

speaker: Kirby
text: Uh, well, today I learned about William Henry Harrison, who was our...

speaker: Kirby
text: ...uh, ninth president.

speaker: Frasier
text: I mean tenth. [_Frasier waves._] I mean ninth.

speaker: Lana
text: Good, not bad.  So you're one step closer to getting your prom privileges back.

speaker: Kirby
text: Mom, I told you, I'm not goin'.

speaker: Lana
text: Why not?  Because you and Kristi broke up?

speaker: Kirby
text: Thanks for spreadin' that around, Mom!

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, Frasier doesn't care.  He went to the prom with his brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for spreading THAT around!  Kirby, listen, can I have a word alone with your mother, please?

speaker: Kirby
text: Sure.

speaker: Lana
text: Here, sit in the car.  You can listen to the radio.

speaker: Lana
text: But don't change my presets again.  When you're in my car, it's my hits OR NOTHING!

speaker: Lana
text: What did you want to talk about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, I was wondering if you'd had a chance to talk to Claire, yet, seeing as how Kirby may be getting a passing grade.

speaker: Lana
text: Actually, I saw Claire yesterday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you did!  That's wonderful news!  Now, I was thinking for our first date, I thought perhaps Tapas.  Now I know that sounds a little whimsical, but hear me out on this...

speaker: Lana
text: Frasier, Frasier, look, all I did was mention you were tutoring Kirby.  But she was very impressed.

speaker: Frasier
text: But you were supposed to set us up.  We had a deal!

speaker: Lana
text: I'm phasing you in slowly.  Look, she just broke up with Neil because he was rushing things.  Trust me, if you don't time this right you're going to blow it.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, there's no need to explain it to me.  If anyone understands the value of restraint and taking things slowly, it's yours truly.

speaker: Lana
text: Frasier, as I recall, on our first date, you got me up to your apartment on false pretenses, you plied me with wine, you got me into bed and then tried to weasel out of ever seeing me again. _She goes out the door.  Frasier opens the door behind her and calls out._

speaker: Frasier
text: I think "plied" is a bit strong!  _He closes the door, looking embarrassed.  FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - Cafe Nervosa  Fade in.  Roz is getting a coffee to go and turns to join Frasier at a table._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.  I have a work-related proposal I want to run by you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz, I'm always open to new ideas.  Creative thoughts, outside-the-box thinking, that sort of thing.

speaker: Roz
text: I want Friday the fifteenth off.  But be aware, if you say "No," you'll be crushing a dream I've had since college.

speaker: Frasier
text: A three-day weekend, that's quite a dream.

speaker: Roz
text: My dream is to have front row seats at Bruce Springsteen. That way, when he starts doing "Dancing in the Dark", there's a chance he'll pull me up on stage with him.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  And this concert is on a Friday afternoon?

speaker: Roz
text: No, grandpa.  The tickets go on sale Saturday and I want to be the first in line.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, if you hadn't called me "grandpa," I would have found a polite way to no, but as it is, no.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't believe I could have just called in sick instead of telling you the truth.  I just wasted perfectly good honesty on you! _She gets up to leave, running into Daphne and Niles as they are coming in._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: His Royal Highness is here.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: Coffee, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, please.  I'll have the French roast, with three shots of espresso.

speaker: Daphne
text: The Defibrillator?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, that's the one.

speaker: Frasier
text: A quick little pick-me-up, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I am exhausted.  Sleeping with Daphne, I'm not getting any rest.  The way she gyrates, it's like...

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop the simile!  No use in conjuring up imagery I'll only have to repress later.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm talking about actual sleeping, you degenerate jughead.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, sweetie.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.  I was just telling Frasier about your nightly tossing and turning.

speaker: Niles
text: She's like a tuna on a trawler deck.

speaker: Daphne
text: I told you: I'm gonna need time to adjust to sleeping with someone.  Until then you're just going to have to fight me off.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I tried, you hurled me to the floor!

speaker: Daphne
text: You've never minded the rough stuff before.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_closes his book_] No that's it, I'm leaving.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, it's Claire.

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought you liked her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I do.

speaker: Niles
text: So what's the problem?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lana has told me I am under no circumstances to ask her out on a date!  She says that if I rush things, I will ruin my chances.

speaker: Claire
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Claire, hi.  Fancy seeing you here.

speaker: Claire
text: I just came from the opera house.  Can you believe _Don Giovanni_ is sold out?  I wish I knew someone with a subscription.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you know, I could... I could call someone for you.

speaker: Claire
text: Oh, hey, that would be great.  And hey, while you're at it, see if you can't find someone who likes sherry.  You know, Les Habitants is having a tasting that week and I can't find anyone who enjoys sherry as much as I do.  Of course, I always have trouble finding people who share my interests, I've been trying to convince someone to go to London with me and see the new Tate Gallery and the Old Globe Theater and finally I just gave up and tomorrow I'm going alone for ten days.  Life's just too short!

speaker: Frasier
text: Go out with me!  _As Claire looks surprised, Frasier looks around for a way to seem a little calmer.  FADE OUT._  **A WAIST IS A TERRIBLE THING TO MIND**  _Scene 4 - Lana's Kitchen  Fade in.  Kirby is sitting at the table with the textbook, Frasier is lecturing a point to him._

speaker: Frasier
text: The trick to remembering the difference between William Henry Harrison and William Howard Taft is a simple mnemonic device.

speaker: Kirby
text: A what?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a trick.  Harrison died in office after his first month, so we say "William Henry Harrison Was Hardly Healthy".  And you can't spell "Taft" without the letters f-a-t.

speaker: Kirby
text: So now to remember two things, I have to remember two other things.  Plus the first two things.  That's FOUR things.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, but the first two things are easier to remember and they are clues to the second.  Will you just try to keep up, Kirby?

speaker: Kirby
text: What are you getting all up in my face for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because you are not working hard enough.

speaker: Kirby
text: Well, who's fault is that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yours!

speaker: Kirby
text: Whatever, dude.

speaker: Lana
text: How's it going?

speaker: Kirby
text: Well, I'm cool.

speaker: Frasier
text: As am I.

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, Frasier, you staying for dinner?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure.

speaker: Lana
text: Kirby, go wash up. [_He gets up and heads out._] And USE WATER!

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Lana, um... I, I ran into Claire this afternoon, and well, we got to talking, and it seems as though we'll... we're going to be going out together.

speaker: Lana
text: You what?  I told you the timing wasn't right.  You went behind my back!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well you convinced me you held the keys to Claire's kingdom and the truth is, I didn't need the key!  When I got there the gates were open, the mat said "Welcome Frasier"!

speaker: Lana
text: Well, if you think you are walking out on Kirby, you can think again!

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, there is no point in tutoring him if he is not willing to learn!

speaker: Claire
text: [_v.o. from answering machine_] Hi, Lana, it's Claire.  Listen, Frasier asked me out today and I said yes.  He seems very sweet. [_Frasier grins._] Of course, he was also a little eager which is always a turn-off. [_Frasier's grin fades._] So I might back out, unless you think he's a catch, do you, is he?  So anyway, I'll be back next week, give me a call, let me know what you think, bye.

speaker: Lana
text: [_now the one smiling smugly_] Hmmm, what do I think?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps I spoke hastily.

speaker: Lana
text: I think... I want Kirby to get a C.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  You said all he had to get was a passing grade!

speaker: Lana
text: Well, that's before you went behind my back.  And just for arguing, I want a B!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's crazy!

speaker: Lana
text: Well, keep talking mister, and I'll go for an A!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, a B it is!

speaker: Kirby
text: What am I doing again?  Oh yeah, I'm washing up.

speaker: Lana
text: Okay, a B minus.  _FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Niles' Bedroom  Fade in.  Niles and Daphne are again in bed.  When Daphne moves in her sleep, Niles nervously comes awake, then settles back down.  Daphne rolls to the side with the covers and Niles tenses defensively.  Daphne rolls back towards him, then swings her arm back across his chest, where Niles throws his hands up to catch it.  He rolls her back over to her side of the bed.  Getting his watch from the nightstand, he notes the time with a look of frustration.  As he starts to settle down again, Daphne begins rolling to his side of the bed quickly.  Niles leaps over her, but misjudges his inertia and keeps moving to fall off the side of the bed.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 -- Cafe Nervosa  Fade in.  Kirby and Frasier are at a tutoring session._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Kirby, I'm going to make you an offer: If you will agree to knuckle down and study, I will treat you to a sumptuous meal at Les Habitants.  How does that sound?

speaker: Kirby
text: You and me at a fancy French restaurant?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's right.

speaker: Kirby
text: Kinda gay.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Roz.  Kirby, this is my producer, Roz Doyle. Roz, this is Kirby, my... tutee.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, study hard, but remember: school isn't everything. I wasn't exactly an egghead and look how I turned out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right, Roz.  I'm just trying to motivate the boy, not scare him straight.

speaker: Kirby
text: She has gotta be pretty distracting around the office, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, well, sometimes.  But she's union, so you put up with it.

speaker: Kirby
text: No, I mean she's hot!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just stop that.  You stick to girls your own age.

speaker: Kirby
text: Yeah, I had one, she dumped me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry to hear that.

speaker: Kirby
text: I don't care.  She can go to the prom with anyone she wants.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait a moment.  Is that what all this current malaise is about? Heartbreak?

speaker: Kirby
text: No!  I'm way over it.  But you know what would be awesome is if I could go to the prom with some totally hot older chick like Roz.  That would totally burn up Kristi.  All my friends would be like "Whoa, she's so hot!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Kirby, you just put that thought completely out of your mind because....

speaker: Frasier
text: Kirby, if I could convince Roz to go to the prom with you, would you commit to learning this material? And think hard before you answer, because if it's "yes", you're in my house, mister.

speaker: Kirby
text: I'm in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Deal.  Now listen, we'll just keep this between us.  There's no need to tell your mom.

speaker: Kirby
text: No problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.

speaker: Kirby
text: So, how you gonna get her to go with me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you just leave that up to me and Mr. Bruce Springsteen.

speaker: Kirby
text: [_raising a fist_] The Boss!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Bruce Springsteen.  _FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Frasier and Kirby are again studying at the dining table._

speaker: Kirby
text: You never said there was gonna be pop quizzes.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the "pop" part.  But don't despair, Kirby, you got nineteen out of twenty-five, well done. [_laughs_] Looks like you're well on your way to that prom.  Now let's see that essay you wrote.  _As Kirby hands it over, Martin comes from his room playing tug-o-war with Eddie._

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie, Eddie, Eddie, Eddie...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you mind?  We're trying to work here.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry, I'm just trying to raise Eddie's spirits.  Today's that stupid doggy party he wasn't invited to.

speaker: Frasier
text: You still on that?

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie's the heart and soul of that doggy group.  He's been goin' to that park for years.  Half those people wouldn't even know each other if it wasn't for us.  Now they're down there drinkin' beer and swappin' stories.  Look at him, it's just breaking Eddie's heart.

speaker: Frasier
text: Eddie's fine, Dad.  Seems you're the one who feels left out.

speaker: Martin
text: I do not!  And it just so happens that we've got plans for this afternoon, anyway, big plans.

speaker: Martin
text: Hello? [_nonchalant_] Oh, hi, Roger.  Oh, party?  No, hadn't heard about it.  Oh, really?  Well, yeah I guess we could come down.  Sure, okay.  Well, uh, be right down.  Okay, bye.

speaker: Martin
text: I knew it!  The invite musta got lost in the mail.  Well, see you later boys, it's party time!  _He goes out the front.  Eddie goes to the arm of the couch expectantly.  Martin comes back in a moment later._

speaker: Martin
text: [_sheepish_] Forgot the dog.   _Scene 4 - Les Habitants  Fade in.  Claire and Frasier are at a table together._

speaker: Frasier
text: This is fun.

speaker: Claire
text: It is.  You know, I think restaurants are like museums. Great food, like great art, has the ability to both elevate and inspire.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I so agree.  But one must dine with some _savoir faire_. You won't get much out of it if you're just some Philistine walking in off the street.

speaker: Friend
text: Dude, fancy!

speaker: Kirby
text: [_to Maitre D'_] Hello, my good man.  Reservation for Gardner.

speaker: Maitre D'
text: Of course.  This way, please.

speaker: Kirby
text: [_whispering to Roz_] So, um, would you order some wine for us?

speaker: Roz
text: No.  Let's get something straight: if you get drunk, the evening is over.  And if you fondle, massage or cup any portion of my body the evening is over.  Got it?

speaker: Kirby
text: Man, you're like a total prude, huh?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, I am.

speaker: Maitre D'
text: [_as they sit_] Would any one of you like a drink?

speaker: Kirby
text: Yes.  The lady and I will have the Coca Cola.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, and make sure the lady's has a lot of Jack Daniels in it. [_to Kirby_] Never order for your date, it's cheesy.

speaker: Frasier
text: And the lady will have the filet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, a toast: To this moment, too long delayed and too quick to pass.

speaker: Lana
text: Hey, you guys!  Hi.  What are you doing here? [_gives Frasier a playful shove_]

speaker: Claire
text: We're having a date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, what are YOU doing here? [_gives her a warning shove_]

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, I'm looking for Kirby, it's his prom night, he left his camera at home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kirby?  Is here?

speaker: Lana
text: Somewhere, he said you told him about this place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right.  So I did.

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, there he is.  See you guys later.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Listen, Lana, Lana, wait!  You know, maybe I should take the camera to the boy.  I mean, seeing you here will only embarrass him.

speaker: Lana
text: Oh please, he's used to that.  Besides, the one who should be embarrassed is that boy who's with his mother. _Frasier sits back down, looking nervous as Lana goes over to the other table._

speaker: Claire
text: Lana is such a great mom.  She really cares about her kids.

speaker: Frasier
text: She sure does.

speaker: Lana
text: WHAT DO YOU MEAN, SHE'S WITH YOU?!?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you excuse me a moment?

speaker: Kirby
text: Mom, would you cool out?

speaker: Lana
text: How do you expect me to cool out when you're with... what are you, a hooker?

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Friend
text: You're a hooker?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I'm not!

speaker: Frasier
text: She works for me.

speaker: Friend
text: You're her pimp?

speaker: Maitre D'
text: Is there a problem?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, everything's perfectly fine.

speaker: Lana
text: You know this tramp?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I do.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry!  Lana, please.  This is all innocent enough. I only did this to motivate the boy.

speaker: Lana
text: By promising him sex?

speaker: Roz
text: You promised him sex?

speaker: Friend
text: You're gettin' sex!

speaker: Frasier
text: I did NOT promise him sex!

speaker: Lana
text: [_grabs Kirby by the arm_] You are coming with me!

speaker: Kirby
text: Mom, I'm not going.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lana, let me explain.  I set him up with Roz in exchange for his studying.

speaker: Lana
text: That's disgusting!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's no different than you promising me a date with Claire in exchange for tutoring Kirby.

speaker: Claire
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Claire.

speaker: Claire
text: You traded me like a commodity?

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, get off your high horse!

speaker: Kirby
text: You tutored me to get to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Kirby...

speaker: Claire
text: I can't believe you used me, Lana!

speaker: Lana
text: Well, get a little perspective here, my son's here with a prostitute!

speaker: Roz
text: [_rising_] If you call me that one more time, lady...!

speaker: Lana
text: Listen, sister, I'll call you anything I want to...!

speaker: Claire
text: What did you do, dangle me like bait?!

speaker: Roz
text: Who's the prostitute now?

speaker: Claire
text: Who the hell are you?

speaker: Lana
text: Sit down!

speaker: Kirby
text: You said you cared about my education, but you're just as big a liar as Richard M. Nixon, our thirty-seventh president!

speaker: Maitre D'
text: I'm going to have to ask you all to leave.

speaker: Lana
text: Fine with me.  Kirby, let's go!

speaker: Kirby
text: I'm not goin' anywhere.

speaker: Claire
text: Well, I am.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, STOP IT EVERYBODY!

speaker: Frasier
text: Fellow diners, if you will all bear with me for just a moment, please.  Kirby, you are going to pass history and you are going to graduate from high school.  Roz, you are going to get your Springsteen tickets.  Lana, if there is anyone with whom your son could expect to have a thoroughly wholesome, innocent and chaste date, it is Roz Doyle.  Claire, the only reason Lana did what she did was out of love for her son.

speaker: Frasier
text: And if I compromised my ethics, it was only because I found myself so... utterly beguiled by you.

speaker: Claire
text: Frasier, you are a strange and charming man.

speaker: Frasier
text: You have no idea.  _FADE OUT.  Scene 5 - A Street in Seattle  Fade in.  Frasier is sitting on a stoop, talking into his cell phone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Lana, it's Frasier.  Yeah, I was hoping I could uh, maybe switch times with Kirby tomorrow.  Say, move it up to four o'clock, just after school?  Great, great, good.  Well, Claire and I have plans.  Yeah, I guess we are hitting it off. [_He laughs._] She said what about me?  You're joking!  Oh, you are joking.  What DID she say about me?  Really?  Well, I guess it just proves she's a sucker for sophistication, taste and, dare I say it, old world charm.   Man: Hey buddy.  If the cops come back around, can I stash something in your bag?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll have to call you back.  _He disconnects and puts the phone away, then pulls a sleeping bag up and hunkers down.  The scene pulls back to reveal he is first in line next to a signboard reading "BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN TICKETS ON SALE SATURDAY 10:00 AM."  FADE OUT._
